contentInOrder.title: Software Engineering In LA
contentInOrder.paragraph-main-1: I recently moved to the Los Angeles area from Charleston, South Carolina. While there, I worked as a systems engineer and graduated Summa Cum Laude from the College of Charleston.
contentInOrder.paragraph-main-2: My time in Charleston was amazing and one of the best learning experiences of my life. I have come to the LA area to take the next step in my career and find out just how much this city has to offer.
contentInOrder.small-subtitle-AboutMe: I have a lifelong passion for learning, problem solving, and new incorporations of technology.
contentInOrder.paragraph-AboutMe-1: My experience in the technology and development industry...
contentInOrder.small-subtitle-Trip: Here is a few photos of our trip across the US to LA!

contentInOrder.title: Systems Engineering Intern
contentInOrder.paragraph-1: I really enjoyed my most recent position as a jr. systems engineer at Blackbaud in South Carolina. Blackbaud is a company that is dedicated to providing software and web application services to nonprofits all over the world- Habitat for Humanity as an example.
contentInOrder.paragraph--2: I was a member of a great devops team that was focusing on deploying new web app features and content to the next release of the Blackbaud Platform. While I was there, I spent a great deal of my time unit testing new features and debugging any errors I found. I was working in a QA role and using technologies like selenium, SonarQube, Visual Studio and a host of other debugging tools. I really loved being part of the devOps team there. I learned so much and was able to put my passion of problem solving and using technology to make an impact into practice.
contentInOrder.paragraph-3: In my time at Blackbaud, I also play a project management role. There were some major changes to some of the web services being used coming in the not too distant future. This meant that we would need to make many changes to our local systems and the configurations we had made. This meant a lot of time needed to be spent understanding those new challenges and relaying them effectively to the client. For example, With one client a new database platform was being implemented and there was concern about coverage and disaster recovery in different regions around the world. I spent a great deal of time researching and diagramming detailed information about these particular concerns and solutions we had to handle any problems that might occur.
contentInOrder.paragraph-4: I also spent time working on onboarding material for new employees. Starting at a new technology company can be hard. Setting up new environments and getting up to speed quickly is always a challenge. I spent time making a video series that went in detail over the tools for development, communication, task management that new developers were likely to need for the onboarding process. There were 20+ videos that covered many different procedures and tricks needed to decrease knowledge gaps one might encounter in the early stages of starting their new position.

contentInOrder.title: The Grave Digger Database
contentInOrder.paragraph: This project was the capstone for the entire course and we made a live demo of our working full stack site at the end of the semester. Check the video below for the demo or my github to find teh source code
contentInOrder.paragraph-2: This project was the final project for one of the best classes I had during my undergraduate. We studied database management, processing, and concepts. To wrap the course up we made a full stack site from scratch modeled after an existing tool or one of our own invention. The web app had to maintain records and allow for user interaction and manipulation in a variety of different ways. The site used a traditional MVC pattern and I wrote most of it in HTML/CSS, bootstrap, javascript, PHP, and hosted the SQL style database on siteground.
contentInOrder.paragraph-3: This project taught me so much about using all the technologies I had learned up to that point in new and interesting ways. I got really creative with the project and modeled it after a tool my parents use for their local business back home in Alabama. They own and operate a number of Funeral homes and cemeteries. There is a tool called nexus that tracks client data and services for families that come in and make arrangements for end of life services. I modeled my system of off this idea and was able to create the GraveDigger Database Tool.
